abstract: Even though revenue rose and customers increased, the phone company reported a loss of $4.22 billion, more than double the loss a year ago.
snippet: Even though revenue rose and customers increased, the phone company reported a loss of $4.22 billion, more than double the loss a year ago.
lead_paragraph: Verizon Communications is still adding plenty of customers and selling a lot of cellphones, but the impact of Hurricane Sandy and pension costs sank the company’s quarterly earnings.

headline.main: Storm and Pension Costs Leave Verizon With Bigger Quarterly Loss
headline.print_headline: Storm and Pension Costs Leave Verizon With Bigger Quarterly Loss
